snippet: Work is being done to improve the hiring of women at technology companies, but the overall numbers remain abysmal.
abstract: Some 18 percent of computer science graduates were women in 2010, but at many prominent tech firms, where coding is king, the percentage of female programmers is in the single digits; those familiar with the field's hiring process attribute the lack of women to the recruiting process itself, with many firms relying on male interviewers who reinforce the profession's geeky, high-testosterone stereotype and give women the impression of a closed and unwelcoming culture.
lead_paragraph: Work is being done to improve the hiring of women at technology companies, but the overall numbers remain abysmal.

headline.seo: Women’s Pipeline to Programming Jobs Has Many Leaks
